title: Throttle Body - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Removal seat, battery, fuel tank DB4; DBB; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU4; DUB; DUC

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DBB; DUC; DTB; DUB; DTC; DU4; DT4; DB4

body.body: Remove left and right hand side panels D34; D54; D64; D72; D92; DA2; DB; DB2; DB4; DBB; DBX; DC; DC3; DC4; DCZ; DD2; DD4; DE; DE2; DEX; DF; DF2; DF4; DG4; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DPZ; DT3; DT4; DTB; DTC; DU; DU3; DU4; DUB; DUC; DUY; DZ

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DCB; DBB; DUC; DTB; DUB; DA2; DTC; DCZ; DPZ; D34; DU4; DT4; DD4; DB4; D64; D54; DC3; DC; DC4; DP4; D72; D92; DG4; DF4; DB2; DU3; DT3; DEX; DD2; DP3; DF2; DF; DP2; DZ; DBX; DB; DE2; DE; DUY; DU; DPA; DP

body.body: Protect the crankcase, crankcase covers and starter motor painted surfaces from damage, using suitable self adhesive tape such as masking tape.
Remove the fixing securing the engine breather hose bracket to the airbox.

body.name: Eng breather pipe to air filter cover cjom

body.body: Release the two hose clips and remove the engine breather hose.
Remove the fixings and remove the air intake finishers. Discard the fixings.
Air intake finisher (right hand side shown)
Remove the two fixings and remove the mountings for the air intake finisher. Discard the fixings.
Note the routing for the throttle actuator and throttle position harnesses for installation.
Disconnect the throttle actuator motor multiplug.
Release the locking device and detach the throttle position sensor multiplug from the mounting bracket.
Disconnect the throttle position sensor multiplug from the main harness.
Note which spigots on the throttle bodies the MAP sensor hose is fitted to and, if fitted, which spigot the evaporative emissions hose is fitted to for installation.
Disconnect the MAP hoses and the evaporative emissions hoses (if fitted) from the throttle bodies.
The clamps securing the throttle bodies to the transition pieces have a spacer fitted between the clamp ends.
The threaded lug is not secure and may fall out when the fixing has been released.
Remove the throttle body four hose clamps.
Carefully detach the throttle bodies from the transition piece hoses and the airbox hoses and remove the throttle bodies.
To remove the transition pieces from the cylinder head, remove the fixings and remove the transition piece(s).
